intro: Hollisteria, commonly known as the holly fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves that are often divided into several lobes. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Hollisteria species produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare member of the Malvaceae family.
